summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being sent.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The federal prosecutor who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mello Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal cover letter for transmitting legal discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell while she was in custody.
It confirms Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn under inmate number 02879-509 as of September 2020.
The criminal case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Audrey Strauss was acting as an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York at that time.
